meanings.definition: A vertical bar between the panes of a window or the panels of a screen.
meanings.sent1: The old house had beautiful mullioned windows that let in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the mullioned glass in the historic building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the mullioned window but got stuck between the bars.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were like mullioned windows, divided yet connected by invisible barriers.
meanings.sent5: The mullioned frames framed the view outside like a painting on the wall.

meanings.sent1: The mullioned door added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The house with mullioned windows looked charming from the outside.
meanings.sent3: The mullioned mirror reflected her image in multiple fragmented views.
meanings.sent4: Her mind felt mullioned, divided between conflicting thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The mullioned archway stood as a symbol of craftsmanship in the ancient castle.
